answers.answer: Bump

I was boarder line for it so I was treated like I had it. I was on the bigger side before I got pregnant.  My mum also had when she was pregnant with me she was tiny. I had a wee boy. I usually ate well and as long as I did my sugars stayed around 6 but if I ate bad or drunk fizz etc I would go up to 9
I was sick all week and am wondering if that couldve threw the test off at all ...
Did you drink the nasty orange color drink?
I wouldn't say so. I went into my test thinking I was fine had the drink felt fine then got results back saying I had it

The test is an hour long test...so its seeing if your body process sugar properly. It wouldn't matter if you were sick before. I was sick for two weeks and i still didn't have it. Im over weight. So ive been check 3 times for it. If you feel you might not have it. Ask to take the test again.

I was 120 when i got pregnant and only 23 so i thought I'd be fine, but i do have it. I ate pretty well and i am having a girl. Its so important to find out for your health and the babies. If you do have it and change your diet, you should have a nornal birth and not a 11 pound baby. Good luck!
Just got diagnosed with itI'm not in best shapeI don't know my numbers but seeing a dietician today. I'm nervous but willing to do whatever it takes

Thanks ladies. I failed the first test and now have to do a 3 hour one, i was pretty surprised bc i eat fairly well. Is it something that i cant control? Mine was a clear drink. The first portion tasted like sprite and the second.tasted like diet coke.
With the drink you have no control over it
Should i feel like its my fault?
No definitely not its out of your control sometimes just happens

I was just recently diagnosed for it. I just got my reader yesterday and need to poke my fingers 5 times a day (not that bad) my diabetes counselor told me that its nothing the mother did wrong so its not what I have eaten in my pregnancy whether or not I've had a lot of sugary foods. She said it has to do with the placenta stopping the breaking down of sugars. It was a relief hearing that cuz I blamed myself and my eating habits but she said its uncontrollable.

Im glad to hear that its not my fault. I was racking my brain because i know i havent been eating that bad. I hope we all have healthy and safe pregnancies. I hear a lot of people who fail the first test pass the second one ...
Ya. I wanted cry when she told me that. I'm doing my best to control it and ya, I just commented on ur other post about that lol it happens a lot.
Thanks ladies. Ill just wait pray and hope its a no if not i cant control the results.Thanks

I have it and just as was said above if u have it it's not always ur fault I wasn't over weight when I got preg either time but both times Iv been preg iv gained weight like crazy .. my 1st I was borderline they didn't have me test daily and my son had dangerously  low blood sugar when he was born I got back down to normal size and shot right back up to the same weight I was w my 1st by 30 wks :( I see a dietician poke my finger 4 times a day take metformin 850 and 10 units of insulin plus follow a strict diet and my numbers r still all over the place my son is also measuring 6 days ahead .. I hope this isn't ur case it stinks maybe ul b lucky and can keep it under control w diet . I wish mine was that easy . Good luck momma
Wow hab i am so sorry to hear that. Luckily and thankfully my weight gain has been gradual and i pray it continues that way. I will pray for you :)
Thank u ! I will pray u do not have gestational diabetes! It stinks lol
I had all my test comes back fine but my suger. It was high. I get to go in for a 3 hour long test just incase.

question: Just curious how many of you mamas have gestational diabetes? Were you overweight before? Did you eat a lot of sweet foods? Also, what are you having a boy or girl and what number was your blood sugar?
title: gestational diabetes ... plz answer
